decks.notes: The main concept behind this deck is to utilize the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to quickly create a 20/20 Marit Lage token, which can easily win the game. The deck includes various ways to either search for or protect the combo pieces, such as Elvish Reclaimer, Crop Rotation, and Sylvan Safekeeper. Additional cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Cabal Therapy provide extra utility and disruption to control the game and ensure the combo can be successfully executed.

The main strategy of this BUG Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption, while generating card advantage through card draw and card selection. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent with powerful planeswalkers and efficient threats like Tarmogoyf. It also utilizes the Punishing Fire and Grove of the Burnwillows combo to gain incremental advantage. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game and grinding out wins through attrition.

The deck focuses on using a series of efficient spells and rituals to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing the player to cast a spell such as Ad Nauseam or Tendrils of Agony to win the game in a single turn. By using cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal to generate mana and cards like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual to generate even more mana, the player can chain together spells to create a storm of casting spells in one turn to secure victory.

The deck focuses on generating mana and using artifacts to control the game while creating a loop with Mystic Forge to play cards from the top of the library. With the combination of cards like Paradox Engine, Defense Grid, and Ensnaring Bridge, the deck aims to establish a lock on the opponent while assembling a win condition. By utilizing cards like Karn, the Great Creator to tutor for key artifacts and Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's plans, the deck seeks to overwhelm and out-resource the opponent in a fast-paced combo strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down opponents, while also utilizing powerful equipments like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice through Stoneforge Mystic. With cards like Palace Jailer and Sanctum Prelate providing additional control elements, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' game plans while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Mirran Crusader and Flickerwisp. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Karakas to manipulate the board state, the deck seeks to outmaneuver opponents and establish dominance through a combination of disruption and aggression.

The deck focuses on assembling a fast-paced board presence of Human creatures, supported by disruptive cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage. Aggressively utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and protect them with Mother of Runes, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of powerful abilities and tribal synergy. The inclusion of disruptive elements like Sanctum Prelate and Kitesail Freebooter adds another layer of control, allowing the deck to disrupt the opponent's game plan while developing its own board presence.

The key concept of this Legacy Jund Aggro deck is to efficiently disrupt and control the opponent with discard spells like Hymn to Tourach, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Thoughtseize, while applying pressure with powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Bloodbraid Elf. The deck also utilizes versatile removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Abrupt Decay, and gains incremental advantage with cards like Wrenn and Six, Punishing Fire, and Liliana of the Veil. The mana base is carefully constructed with a mix of dual lands and utility lands to support the aggressive yet controlling game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through a combination of aggressive creatures and direct burn spells. By using cheap and efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, alongside creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish a strong board presence. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Price of Progress also punishes the opponent for playing non-basic lands, further adding pressure to the opponent and closing out games quickly.

The deck focuses on control and disruption, using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler along with efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Liliana's Triumph. It also utilizes cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also having access to counter magic with Force of Will and Force of Negation. The mana base is designed to support the various colors needed for the spells in the deck, with the inclusion of Snow-Covered lands for synergy with Astrolabe.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Dark Depths combo using Thespian's Stage and Crop Rotation to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It also utilizes cards like Wrenn and Six, Knight of the Reliquary, and Elvish Reclaimer to find the necessary pieces and protect your combo from disruption. The deck also includes a mix of removal and protection spells to control the board and ensure the combo can go off smoothly.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently get powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield by utilizing cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. This allows the player to bypass traditional mana costs and overwhelm the opponent with huge threats early in the game. The deck also includes card draw and counterspells to help protect the combo and ensure its success. The mana base is designed to support the high-powered spells and enable the combo to be executed smoothly.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands as both a resource and a win condition, with cards like Life from the Loam, Crop Rotation, and Gamble to search for key lands like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. It aims to control the opponent's resources through disruption and attrition, with cards like Punishing Fire and Wasteland to disrupt their mana base. The deck also includes utility lands like Karakas and Maze of Ith to protect key threats or stall the opponent. Overall, the deck seeks to grind out an advantage using its lands and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan effectively.

This Control-Stoneblade deck focuses on using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis, along with powerful equipment fetched by Stoneforge Mystic, to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes a suite of counterspells and removal spells to protect its threats and deal with opposing threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and to disrupt the opponent's mana base with Wasteland. The key strategy is to establish a dominant board presence while preventing the opponent from executing their game plan.

The main concept of the deck is to generate value from land interactions, utilizing cards like Exploration, Life from the Loam, and Wrenn and Six to repeatedly play and reuse land cards. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards such as Mox Diamond and Knight of the Reliquary, while controlling the opponent's board with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Wasteland. The combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage is a win condition, while also utilizing cards like Crop Rotation and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key pieces as needed.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is to control the game through land disruption, counterspells, and card advantage. The deck aims to use cards like Wasteland, Crop Rotation, and Ghost Quarter to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while utilizing cards like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to counter key spells. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and selection with Brainstorm and Ponder, along with powerful planeswalkers like Wrenn and Six and Jace, the Mind Sculptor for additional value. The deck also includes removal like Abrupt Decay and board wipes like Toxic Deluge for added flexibility.

The deck focuses on deploying efficient and disruptive Eldrazi creatures early in the game, while also utilizing disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Thalia to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast aggro strategy, supported by powerful lands like Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple. The inclusion of cards like Karakas and Stoneforge Mystic provide additional utility and flexibility. By combining strong creatures with disruptive elements, the deck aims to apply pressure and control the game to secure a victory before the opponent can establish their game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to control the opponent's resources by utilizing land destruction with cards like Wasteland and Punishing Fire. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan through cards like Chalice of the Void and Abrupt Decay, while also maintaining card advantage with Dark Confidant and Sylvan Library. The deck also has a strong creature presence with Tarmogoyf, Scavenging Ooze, and Knight of the Reliquary, supported by planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six. The deck prioritizes resource management and board control to dominate the battlefield.

The main concept of this Dark Depths combo deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths/Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck includes cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Vampire Hexmage to tutor or remove counters from Dark Depths. It also features disruption through Thoughtseize, Duress, and Pithing Needle to protect the combo. Additionally, the deck includes ways to protect Marit Lage with cards like Not of This World and Sejiri Steppe, as well as utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Karakas.

The core strategy of this deck revolves around using prison-style cards like Blood Moon, Trinisphere, and Ensnaring Bridge to control the board and slow down the opponent. In addition, it aims to ramp up quickly with mana acceleration cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to get ahead early in the game. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Karn, the Great Creator and Chandra, Torch of Defiance to provide additional threats and card advantage. Overall, the deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence.
